title: Shirtless man working out in popular Sydney children's playground park angers parents
text:
Parents were left furious after a shirtless man turned a children's playground into his own gym during a public workout.

The fitness fanatic blasted loud dance music while doing reps at Steyne Park in Sydney's exclusive Double Bay, angering parents who had taken their young children to play.

'I thought maybe he had a kid here and was just doing some exercise on the side,' a mother told Daily Mail Australia.

'That would have been slightly more acceptable, (it was) the weirdest thing I've ever seen in my life. Why would you do that?

A parent who had taken their children to the park said the public workout was the 'weirdest thing' they'd ever seen in their life

The fitness fanatic blasted loud music while finishing his reps, angering parents who had taken their young children to play in the Sydney park

'Parents were so baffled they didn't know what to do.'

The man, wearing only shorts and sneakers, could be seen performing planking exercises next to play equipment, just metres from a toddler.

The fitness fanatic then took his workout to a nearby park bench, while people enjoying their lunch watched on.

'He turns up shirtless, cranked up the dance music and was using the playground to work out,' the mother said.

'I texted a few of my mum mates and asked 'is this weird or is it just me?' and they all said it was inappropriate.

A father who had also taken his children to play at the park told the woman he felt uncomfortable having his kids there during the man's workout.

'The dad went over and said ''mate, is there anywhere else for you to work out?'' and asked him to leave.

'The guy said he was nearly finished anyway and just carried on doing chin ups with the play equipment.'
description: The fitness fanatic blasted loud dance music while finishing his reps, angering parents who had taken their young children to play at Steyne Park in Sydney's exclusive Double Bay.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
